page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area includes the northern part of the Island of Brecqhou and the north western corner of Sark. The majority of the block, however, is sea. This part of Brecqhou is rocky coastline with cliffs allowing no easy access to the sea. Similar features are to be found on the Sark mainland, although the ground does level off leading to the main plateau of the island. The cliffs have a number of caves in them the most famous of which are the Boutiques Caves where pirate treasures are said to have been stored. Access to these caves and to the sandy bays is possible at low tide. The Window is an artificial opening in a natural rock wall through which goods were hauled up the sheer cliff.
